intro: Epidanthus crassus, commonly known as the broad-leaf epidanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. Epidanthus crassus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and unique floral display.
